dataCsv.Site_Description: : The wreck lies in 656 ft of water four miles east of Two Harbors, MN in Lake Superior.  The wreck is the most intact shipwreck in Minnesota waters.  It lies upright and on a heading of 153 degrees.  The hull except for the collision point is totally intact.  The forward cabins below the forecastle deck are intact.  The pilot house is came off and drifted to the beach at Knife River at the time of sinking.  The walls of the captain’s quarters below the pilot house are extant but collapsed outward.  The aft cabins below the main deck are also intact.  Some of the paint is still on the wreck and traces of the names can still be discerned on both the sides and stern of the ship.
